{"step_by_step_thinking": "The branches of the external carotid artery (ECA) that supply the nasal septum include the anterior ethmoidal artery and the sphenopalatine artery. The anterior ethmoidal artery supplies the anterior part of the nasal septum, while the sphenopalatine artery supplies the posterior part. The facial artery and the superior labial artery are branches of the ECA, but they do not supply the nasal septum. Therefore, the correct answer is C. Facial artery.", "answer_choice": "C"}
